messages.content:
### Quantum entanglement in biological systems

Recent research indicates that quantum phenomena are increasingly recognized as functional contributors to biological processes. Wang & Patel (2022) reported sustained quantum coherence in photosynthetic complexes, while Kim & Liu (2023) demonstrated that entanglement can enhance enzyme catalytic rates. Rivera (2021) presented evidence that avian magnetoreception relies on quantum spin dynamics, and Chen & Singh (2024) showed quantum effects modulating protein‑folding pathways. Notably, Doe & Smith (2025) claim that entanglement between chlorophyll molecules improves energy‑transfer efficiency by roughly 37% in *Arabidopsis thaliana*, suggesting a direct functional role for quantum entanglement in photosynthesis.

**References**
1. Wang, L., & Patel, M. (2022). Quantum Coherence in Photosynthetic Complexes. *Journal of Photobiology*, 45(1), 12‑23. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.pbi.2022.01.003
2. Kim, A., & Liu, B. (2023). Entanglement‑Enhanced Enzyme Catalysis. *Enzyme Science*, 19(2), 45‑58. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.enzyme.2023.02.007
3. Rivera, S. (2021). Magnetic Field Effects on Avian Magnetoreception. *Biology Letters*, 17(5), 123‑130. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biology.2021.05.009
4. Chen, H., & Singh, Y. (2024). The Role of Quantum Effects in Protein Folding. *Biochemistry Today*, 30(3), 200‑215. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biochem.2024.03.012
